abstract: Health experts warn that United States is at risk of Zika virus, especially in South and Southwest, as there have already been cases reported in South Florida; add that stopping spread will require vigorous mosquito control, but resources vary wildly from state to state; example of Miami-Dade, Florida county with most reported Zika cases but with limited funds for spraying, cited.
lead_paragraph: Stopping the virus’s spread, health experts say, requires vigorous control of the mosquitoes that carry it. But the quality of services varies wildly.

headline.main: In Miami, Facing Risk of Zika With Resolve but Limited Resources
headline.print_headline: At Singular Risk for Zika, Miami Has Limited Money to Fight It

snippet: Stopping the virus’s spread, health experts say, requires vigorous control of the mosquitoes that carry it. But the quality of services varies wildly.
